arm_group.description: Four types of suture including  silk,  polypropylene, PGA, and PTFE

brief_summary.textblock:
The aims of this study were to evaluate and compare tissue erythema, edema and knot
      loosening among four types of suture one week after periodontal surgery.

clinical_study.brief_title: Clinical Evaluation of Sutures in Periodontal Surgery

detailed_description.textblock:
Forty patients participated in this prospective, randomized, double-blind clinical trial.
      Vertical mattress sutures were used following resective periodontal surgery performed by one
      operator. Four suture materials were selected for evaluation: 5-0 silk; 5-0 polypropylene;
      5-0 polyglycolic acid (PGA), and 4-0 polytetrafluoroethylene (PTFE). Seven days after the
      surgical procedure, the surgeon assessed suture loosening and removed the sutures. A blind
      researcher clinically evaluated erythema and edema.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Qualification for the study was based on the need for resective periodontal surgery
             (apically positioned flap and osseous recontouring) at four or more consecutive
             interproximal sites per quadrant

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  systemic diseases, such as diabetes, chronic obstructive pulmonary disease, or an
             immunologic disease that would affect wound healing; allergies to prescribed
             medication; and/or current pregnancy or breast feeding were excluded from the study

study_pop.textblock:
patients treated at the CUO (dental clinic at the Universitat Internacional de Catalunya)
        that are prescribed for periodontal resective surgery

intervention.description: surgical periodontal debridement is performed after periodontal phase I

clinical_study.official_title: Clinical Evaluation of Four Types of Suture in Periodontal Surgery

oversight_info.authority: Spain: Comité Ético de Investigación Clínica

primary_outcome.description: Seven days after the surgical procedure, the surgeon assessed suture loosening; recording loose or not Loose
primary_outcome.measure: presence or absence of Suture loosening

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Seven days after the surgical procedure a blind researcher clinically evaluated erythema and edema. Adding a score related to a gingival index
secondary_outcome.measure: presence and level of erythema and edema.
